Wellllll....MOST people gain lifelong immunity to measles.  But immune systems are not all the same, just as people are not all the same.  Some do not mount completely effective immune responses to measles, and seem to only suppress the virus for a time.  It remains latent in these people's cells, especially neurons, and can reactivate years later, causing the fatal brain degeneration known as subacute sclerosing panencephalitis.   the son of a friend of mine died of SSPE at age 8 after surviving a case of the measles as an infant.

The diversity of viruses is greater than that of animals, so its unsurprising that the immune system has diverse responses to them (able to provide life long immunity to some but not all). Using coexistence as a strategy is sensible, not just for fighting viruses either, it's sometimes more costly to fight than coexist; i hear pathogens often evolve towards coexistence though of course there's no one strategy and as the host or virus changes the best strategy alters. Different life strategies for a virus require it to be made up in a different way; you need more genetic information to circumvent host defenses which requires certain genetic material (dsDNA can be bigger than RNA) and stops the virus using other strategies (e.g. it has to be big for all those genes so can't sneak in undetected as well)
So... It's not a dumb virus that makes itself go extinct by killing its hosts.

This reminds me of a older documentary where they showed why old virus are usually of lower danger then new species. If a virus is young, it uses all his power to break the immune system and spread as much at it can. A example would be ebola. The problem is that often the vuus is too sucsesful- too many cells of the host can no longer do they work and the host dies often before the virus can spread, killing itself. Older virus has learned to be way less aggressive. The host usually survives and can infect more people. Also after some generations the immune system of the host learned that it did not have to go full power against this enemy and use it as a practice. Some ancient virus are even so successful, that they become a part of us. Without the outbreak during pregnancy the immune system if your mother would have killed you. All mammals live thanks to a virus.
